abstract: The New York attorney general’s office is concerned that Arbitron does not plan to put devices that measure radio audiences in the hands of enough minority listeners.
snippet: The New York attorney general’s office is concerned that Arbitron does not plan to put devices that measure radio audiences in the hands of enough minority listeners.
lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general’s office said Tuesday that it was opening an investigation into the way that Arbitron, which measures audiences for radio stations, is deploying devices called personal people meters.

headline.main: New York Investigates a Yardstick for Radio
headline.print_headline: New York Investigates A Yardstick For Radio
